message: September 19, 2011
6th on the Kindle, 9th for paperback
Thanks Scotty
Yay! I finally found an e-mail address I hadn't used for a failed Convore sign-up attempt yet!
Im Tower these days.
Yes, it really is episode 35 this time. Joshua Nozzi is back to complete his run down on Xcode 4
The audio feed for todays show will go live about 15 minutes before the show starts so thats around 5pm GMT / 12PM EST / 9AM PST and can be found at http://ideveloper.tv:6996/ideveloperlive
Today we are looking at the stuff Joshua doesn't like about Xcode 4.  Why not post what you don't like here and lets see if there is any concensus
It's not too late to enter in the email book draw for a copy of Joshuas Master Xcode book. Just send an email to scotty@ideveloper.tv with the subject book draw
I dont like that i can't move group of files between projects in Xcode 4...
Also when i create new group Xcode should let me change its name asap
Option+double-click opens the documentation viewer but not to the keyword I double-clicked
SSteve: Xcode search for keyword which i option double click, looks fine for me...
Interesting. I wonder what I'm doing wrong. Here's what happens on my machine (OS X 10.6.8, Xcode 4.2): http://theuniversalsteve.com/files/xcode_documentation.mov
Ah yes it search for keyword but dont display first result...
its just comforting knowing its there ;-P
Plenty of words can describe the music. I don't know if "soothing" can be included on that list. :-)
The Audio Feed is now live with that funky sound
I'm ready to go, Scotty.
I think we're going to have to release an iDeveloper TV soundtrack
hanging out,... but the hold music went away... eerily quiet.
3 minutes to go
had to reload the live feed but the soothing music is back
howdy. another monday. yay.
Greatest hits and misses
just imagine the joy people would feel if this loop played 24/7 between live shows
hey, how's everyone doing today?
itunes say sept 3 Hmm

I was wondering whether iDeveloper offered any sort of preview clips of their courses?  I'm interested in purchasing their iOS Development course, but would love to get a glimpse into what it offers (and the style of teaching)
thanks for that!
RAWR
First 3 people to tell me the publication date of Joshua's book can have an e-book version of it
Missing IBPlugins really suck
Phew... better late than never. Hope I've missed the traditional Raaaaawwwwssss.
rawr.
RARW

frankiesshakes; I'm not sure if there's a preview, but I think you should just go ahead and buy it at the reduced price today. The courses are in a laid back conversational style with plenty of examples. They're genrally quite brilliant, really.
And "many people are using it" is very vague. There's about four prominent open source components: RBSplitView, BWToolkit, ...? Who else has an IBPlugin.
I've actually had great results with xcode4 source control so far

I've got a question too this week. If I have a localised file is there an easy way to move the various component files to a new folder if I want to copy the files for a new target or just move them to a new folder? Xcode seems really bad at detecting files in the localised folders.
I should have just kept my mouth shut! :-S
RAWR!
"User defined runtime attributes" is a help, though
(In the Identity Inspector in Xcode's Interface Builder's Info palette)
In Apple's defense: It's darned hard to create a decent IBPlugin. I've tried many times, haven't managed a single time.
So I hope whatever comes, it's simpler to set up for simple custom views.
Life's to short for Terminal.
I've seen plenty of ibplugins over the years but you're right - there are only a few major, oft-cited items.
you're not alone scotty - switching tabs takes a few seconds most of the time and it's driving me mad
"nippyness"?
